title: Worked Solution
text:
To determine the ratio of the number of neutrons to the number of protons in a 145Pm nucleus, follow these steps:

$$1$$. $$	extbf{Find the number of protons}$$: Promethium (Pm) has an atomic number of $$61$$, meaning it has $$61$$ protons.

$$2$$. $$	extbf{Find the number of neutrons}$$: The mass number $$y$$ (in this case, $$145$$) is the sum of the protons and neutrons.

$$	ext{Number of neutrons} = 	ext{Mass number} - 	ext{Number of protons}$$

$$	ext{Number of neutrons} = 145 - 61 = 84$$

$$3$$. $$	extbf{Determine the ratio}$$: The ratio of neutrons to protons is:

$$ rac{	ext{Number of neutrons}}{	ext{Number of protons}} =  rac{84}{61}$$

Thus, the ratio of the number of neutrons to the number of protons in a 145Pm nucleus is $$ rac{84}{61}$$.
